data.title: List of 1939 musical films
data.meta_description: The list "1939 musical films" has been viewed 0 times.
data.text:
The Wizard of Oz 1939 movie based on the book by L. Frank Baum

0 0

Genre: Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Musical

Dorothy Gale is swept away to a magical land in a tornado and embarks on a quest to see the Wizard who can help her return home. more »

The Wizard of Oz is a 1939 American musical fantasy film produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. An adaptation of L. Frank Baum's 1900 children's fantasy novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, the film was primarily directed by Victor Fleming (who left the production to take over the troubled Gone with the Wind), and stars Judy Garland, Frank Morgan, Ray Bolger, Bert Lahr, Jack Haley, Billie Burke and Margaret Hamilton. Noel Langley, Florence Ryerson, and Edgar Allan Woolf received credit for the screenplay, but others made uncredited contributions. The songs were written by Edgar "Yip" Harburg and composed by Harold Arlen. The musical score and incidental music were composed by Herbert Stothart.

1930s English-language films · 4,270T

Films set in farms · 104T

American children's musical films · 17T

First Love 1939 American musical film by Henry Koster

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Romance

Director: Henry Koster

An orphaned boarding-school graduate secretly attends a prestigious ball, where she falls for the boyfriend of her snobbish cousin. more »

rank #2 · 10 3

First Love is a 1939 American musical film directed by Henry Koster and starring Deanna Durbin. Based on the fairy tale Cinderella, the film is about an orphan who is sent to live with her wealthy aunt and uncle after graduating from boarding school. Her life is made difficult by her snobby cousin who arranges that she stay home while the rest of the family attends a major social ball. With the help of her uncle, she makes it to the ball, where she meets and falls in love with her cousin's boyfriend. The film received Academy Award nominations for Best Art Direction, Best Cinematography, and Best Music.

1930s English-language films · 4,266T

Films scored by Hans J. Salter · 127T

American black-and-white films · 23,102T

Babes in Arms 1939 film by Busby Berkeley

0 0

Genre: Musical, Comedy

Director: Busby Berkeley

Producer: Arthur Freed

The struggle of two talented young artists, to make their own way in the show business. more »

Babes in Arms is the 1939 American film version of the 1937 Broadway musical of the same title. Directed by Busby Berkeley, it stars Mickey Rooney and Judy Garland (in their second film together), and features Charles Winninger, Guy Kibbee, June Preisser, Grace Hayes, and Betty Jaynes. The film concerns a group of youngsters trying to put on a show to prove their vaudevillian parents wrong and make it to Broadway. The original Broadway script was significantly revamped, restructured, and rewritten to accommodate Hollywood's needs.

That's Right - You're Wrong 1939 film by David Butler

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Music

Director: David Butler

Producer: David Butler

A fictional-story film in which many of the people seen in it are using their real name portraying the... more »

rank #4 · 1

That's Right – You're Wrong is a 1939 American musical film directed by David Butler and released by RKO Radio Pictures. The film stars Kay Kyser and his band, with a cast that included Adolphe Menjou, Lucille Ball, Edward Everett Horton, Roscoe Karns, and Ginny Simms (as herself).

0 0

Genre: Music, Comedy, Musical

Director: Ray Enright

A young hoofer quits vaudeville to become a composer and hooks up with a Russian ballet troupe. more »

On Your Toes (1936) is a musical with a book by Richard Rodgers, George Abbott, and Lorenz Hart, music by Rodgers, and lyrics by Hart. It was adapted into a film in 1939.

East Side of Heaven 1939 American film

0 0

Genre: Romance, Musical, Family, Comedy

Director: David Butler

Producer: David Butler

A man finds himself the father, by proxy, of a ten-month-old baby and becomes involved in the turbulent lives of the child's family. more »

East Side of Heaven is a 1939 American musical film directed by David Butler and written by William M. Conselman and James V. Kern. The film stars Bing Crosby, Joan Blondell, Mischa Auer, Irene Hervey, C. Aubrey Smith, Robert Kent and Jerome Cowan. Filming took place in Hollywood from January 13 to March 7, 1939. The film was released on April 7, 1939, by Universal Pictures and had its New York premiere at Radio City Music Hall on May 4, 1939. This was another independent production in which Crosby had a financial interest.

The Under-Pup is a 1939 American feature film by Richard Wallace that introduced soprano singing star Gloria Jean to the screen.

The Star Maker 1939 film by Roy Del Ruth

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Biography, Music

This is a film about the life of Gus Edwards, a well known vaudeville composer, entertainer, and producer. more »

rank #9 · 3 1

The Star Maker is a 1939 American musical film directed by Roy Del Ruth, written by Frank Butler, Don Hartman and Arthur Caesar, and starring Bing Crosby, Louise Campbell, Linda Ware, Ned Sparks, Laura Hope Crews, Janet Waldo and Walter Damrosch. Filming started in Hollywood on April 17, 1939 and was finished in June. The film was released on August 25, 1939, by Paramount Pictures, and had its New York premiere on August 30, 1939. It was the only film in which Crosby played a happily married man.
